docs.title: Enterprise
docs.text: Enterprise adds automation, verification, and integration features on top of the OSS core.

docs.title: OSS vs Enterprise
docs.text: Capability OSS Enterprise Deep QE (agentic scans) ✅ ✅ Fix suggestions + verification ❌ ✅ Test generation & scenario packs ❌ ✅ CI outputs (JSONL/JUnit) ❌ ✅ QE dashboard & artifacts UI ❌ ✅ Expert prompt packs ❌ ✅ Optimized SuperQE mode ❌ ✅ IDE integrations (VSCode/LSP) ❌ ✅ Natural Language QE ❌ ✅ ML severity model ❌ ✅ SuperOpt optimizer ✅ (flagged) ✅ (optimized)

docs.title: Included Capabilities
docs.text:
• Fix suggestions + verification
  • Test generation and scenario packs
  • CI outputs (JSONL/JUnit)
  • QE dashboard and artifacts UI
  • IDE/LSP and server integrations
  • Natural language QE
  • Prompt packs and optimized workflows
  • ML severity model

Contact the SuperQode team for access.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text: Welcome to SuperQode (TUI) and SuperQE (CLI)! This guide will help you get up and running with agentic quality engineering. Learn how to set up your project, choose your workflow, and start improving code quality with AI-powered testing.

docs.title: Quick Navigation
docs.text:
• Installation

    Install SuperQode via pip or from source (includes SuperQE). Set up your environment and verify installation.

    Install now

  • Project Setup

    Initialize your project, configure your preferred model, and choose your connection mode.

    Setup guide

  • TUI Workflow

    Interactive Terminal UI for exploratory testing and real-time quality engineering.

    TUI guide

  • CLI Workflow

    SuperQE command-line interface for automation, CI/CD integration, and batch processing.

    CLI guide

  • Configuration

    Configure providers, roles, and settings. Customize SuperQode for your workflow.

    Configure

  • Troubleshooting

    Common issues and solutions. Get help when things go wrong.

    Troubleshooting

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before installing SuperQode, ensure you have:

Requirement Version Notes Python 3.12+ Python 3.12 recommended pip Latest Or uv for isolated installation Git 2.25+ For workspace isolation features

docs.title: Optional Dependencies
docs.text: Tool Purpose Node.js JavaScript/TypeScript linting Go Go project analysis Rust Rust project analysis

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
uv (Recommended)pipFrom Source 
# Install uv if needed
curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh

# Install SuperQode
uv tool install superqode

pip install superqode

git clone https://github.com/SuperagenticAI/superqode.git
cd superqode
pip install -e .

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
# Check version
superqode --version

# View help
superqode --help

docs.title: Step 1: Initialize Your Project
docs.text:
Navigate to your project directory and initialize SuperQode:

cd /path/to/your/project
superqe init

This command will:

  1. Create superqode.yaml using the comprehensive role catalog
  2. Enable core, implemented roles and leave the rest disabled
  3. Let you edit or delete roles you don’t need

If you want the interactive wizard, use superqe init --guided.

docs.title: Step 2: Choose Your Connection Mode
docs.text: SuperQode supports three connection modes. Choose based on your needs:

docs.title: ACP (Agent Client Protocol) - Recommended ⭐
docs.text:
Best for: Teams wanting full coding agent capabilities (file editing, shell, MCP tools)

Why ACP? - Full coding agent features (edit files, run shell, use MCP tools) - Pre-configured agents (Enterprise adds optimized prompt packs) - No API key management (agents handle it) - Most powerful for exploratory testing

Setup: 

# 1. Install an ACP agent (e.g., OpenCode)
npm i -g opencode-ai

# 2. Edit superqode.yaml to configure

In TUI: - Type :connect (or :c for short) for an interactive picker - Or directly: :connect acp opencode

In CLI: superqode connect acp opencode

docs.title: BYOK (Bring Your Own Key)
docs.text:
Best for: Teams using cloud providers with their own API keys

Why BYOK? - Use your existing API keys (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, etc.) - Direct provider integration - Cost control with your accounts - Good for automation and CI/CD

Setup: 

# 1. Set your API key
export GOOGLE_API_KEY=your-api-key-here
# or
export OPENAI_API_KEY=your-api-key-here
# or
export ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=your-api-key-here

# 2. Edit superqode.yaml to set default provider

In TUI: - Type :connect (or :c for short) for an interactive picker - Or directly: :connect byok google gemini-3-pro

In CLI: superqode connect byok google gemini-3-pro

docs.title: Local Models
docs.text:
Best for: Privacy-first teams or offline development

Why Local? - Complete privacy (no data leaves your machine) - No API costs - Works offline - Self-hosted infrastructure

Setup: 

# 1. Start a local model server (e.g., Ollama)
ollama serve

# 2. Pull a model
ollama pull qwen3:8b

# 3. Edit superqode.yaml to configure

In TUI: - Type :connect (or :c for short) for an interactive picker - Or directly: :connect local ollama qwen3:8b

In CLI: superqode connect local ollama qwen3:8b

docs.title: Step 3: Configure Your Model Choice
docs.text:
Edit superqode.yaml to set your preferred connection:

superqode:
  version: "2.0"
  team_name: "My QE Team"

# Choose your default mode
default:
  mode: acp  # or "byok" or "local"
  coding_agent: opencode  # for ACP
  # provider: google        # for BYOK
  # model: gemini-3-pro      # for BYOK
  # provider: ollama         # for Local
  # model: qwen3:8b          # for Local

providers:
  google:
    api_key_env: GOOGLE_API_KEY
  default_model: qwen3:8b
  base_url: http://localhost:11434

docs.title: Role-Based Multi-Agent System
docs.text:
SuperQode uses a role-based multi-agent architecture where different AI agents specialize in different quality engineering tasks:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│              SuperQode Architecture                      │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                          │
│  ┌──────────────┐  ┌──────────────┐  ┌──────────────┐ │
│  │   Security   │  │     API      │  │  Performance │ │
│  │   Tester     │  │   Tester     │  │   Tester     │ │
│  └──────────────┘  └──────────────┘  └──────────────┘ │
│                                                          │
│  ┌──────────────┐  ┌──────────────┐  ┌──────────────┐ │
│  │     Unit     │  │      E2E     │  │  Fullstack   │ │
│  │   Tester     │  │   Tester     │  │  Reviewer    │ │
│  └──────────────┘  └──────────────┘  └──────────────┘ │
│                                                          │
│              ↓ Ephemeral Workspace ↓                     │
│                                                          │
│        Original Code → Sandbox → Revert                 │
│                                                          │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

Key Concepts:

  • Ephemeral Workspace: Agents work in isolated worktrees or snapshots. All changes are reverted after the session.
  • Role Specialization: Each role focuses on specific quality aspects (security, API, performance, etc.)
  • Parallel Execution: Multiple roles can run simultaneously for comprehensive analysis
  • Artifact Preservation: Findings, patches, and reports are saved even though code changes are reverted

docs.title: QE Roles Explained
docs.text:
Role Purpose Best For security_tester Find vulnerabilities (OWASP Top 10, injection, auth) Pre-deployment security audits api_tester Validate API contracts and endpoints API-first projects unit_tester Find coverage gaps and edge cases Code coverage improvement performance_tester Detect bottlenecks (N+1 queries, memory leaks) Performance-critical apps e2e_tester Test complete user workflows Frontend/Fullstack apps fullstack Senior QE comprehensive review Overall quality assessment

Learn more about roles →

docs.title: Two Workflows: Choose Your Path
docs.text: SuperQode offers two distinct workflows designed for different use cases:

docs.title: TUI Workflow (Recommended for Exploratory Testing)
docs.text: Best for: Interactive exploration, ad-hoc testing, learning, and real-time feedback

docs.title: Characteristics
docs.text:
• ✅ Interactive Terminal UI - Rich, visual interface
  • ✅ Real-time feedback - See results as they happen
  • ✅ Exploratory testing - Chat with agents, ask questions
  • ✅ Visual navigation - Browse files, view diffs, explore findings
  • ✅ Session management - Save and resume sessions
  • ✅ Multi-agent handoff - Switch between roles interactively

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
# 1. Launch TUI
superqode

# 2. Connect to your agent (in TUI)
# Option A: Use interactive picker (recommended for first-time users)
:connect
# or type :c for short
# The TUI will guide you through selecting ACP, BYOK, or Local, then show available options

# Option B: Direct connection (if you know exactly what you want)
:connect acp opencode
# or
:connect byok google gemini-3-pro
# or
:connect local ollama qwen3:8b

# 3. Switch to a QE role (in TUI)
:qe security_tester

# 4. Start exploring! Type natural language requests:
# "Check for SQL injection vulnerabilities in the API"
# "Test the authentication flow"
# "Find performance bottlenecks in the database queries"

# Note: To run automated QE sessions, use CLI commands:
# superqe run . --mode quick   # Quick 60-second scan
# superqe run . --mode deep    # Comprehensive 30-minute analysis

# 5. View findings interactively
:view <file>    # View file content
:diff           # See suggested changes
:plan           # View agent's plan

docs.title: TUI Commands Reference
docs.text:
Command Description :connect or :c Interactive connection picker (recommended) :connect acp <agent> Connect directly to ACP agent :connect byok <provider> <model> Connect directly to BYOK provider :connect local <provider> <model> Connect directly to local model :qe <role> Switch to QE role mode (e.g., :qe security_tester) :view <file> View file content :diff View suggested changes :plan View agent's plan :help Show all commands :quit Exit TUI

Full TUI documentation →

docs.title: CLI Workflow (Recommended for Automation)
docs.text: Best for: CI/CD integration, automated testing, batch processing, and scripting

docs.title: Characteristics
docs.text:
• ✅ Command-line interface - Easy to script and automate
  • ✅ CI/CD friendly - JSONL and JUnit XML output
  • ✅ Batch processing - Run on multiple projects
  • ✅ Non-interactive - Perfect for scheduled jobs
  • ✅ Configurable - Everything via config file or flags

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text:
# 1. Initialize project (first time)
superqe init

# 2. Edit superqode.yaml with your model choice

# 3. Run QE session
superqe run . --mode quick

# 4. Run with specific roles
superqe run . --mode deep -r security_tester -r api_tester

# 5. CI/CD output
superqe run . --mode quick --jsonl > results.jsonl
superqe run . --mode quick --junit results.xml

# 6. View artifacts
superqe artifacts .
superqe dashboard

docs.title: Common CLI Commands
docs.text:
# Quick scan
superqe run . --mode quick

# Deep analysis
superqe run . --mode deep

# Specific roles
superqe run . -r security_tester -r api_tester

# With test generation (Enterprise)
superqe run . --mode deep --generate

# With fix suggestions (Enterprise)
superqe run . --mode deep --allow-suggestions

# CI-friendly output (Enterprise)
superqe run . --mode quick --jsonl
superqe run . --mode quick --junit results.xml

# View results (Enterprise)
superqe artifacts .
superqe dashboard
superqe status

Full CLI reference →

docs.title: Use TUI When:
docs.text:
• 🎯 Exploring a codebase for the first time
  • 🎯 Ad-hoc testing and investigation
  • 🎯 Learning how SuperQode works
  • 🎯 Need interactive feedback and real-time results
  • 🎯 Want to chat with agents and ask questions
  • 🎯 Debugging specific issues interactively

docs.title: Use CLI When:
docs.text:
• 🤖 Running in CI/CD pipelines
  • 🤖 Scheduled quality checks (nightly, weekly)
  • 🤖 Batch processing multiple projects
  • 🤖 Automated testing workflows
  • 🤖 Need structured output (JSONL, JUnit XML)
  • 🤖 Scripted or non-interactive environments

docs.title: Complete Setup Example
docs.text:
Here's a complete example from scratch:

# 1. Install SuperQode
pip install superqode

# 2. Navigate to your project
cd ~/projects/my-api

# 3. Initialize configuration
superqe init
# This will:
# - Detect framework (e.g., FastAPI)
# - Create superqode.yaml
# - Suggest recommended roles

# 4. Edit superqode.yaml
nano superqode.yaml
# Set your preferred connection mode and model

# 5. Choose your workflow:

# Option A: TUI (exploratory)
superqode
# Then: :connect acp opencode
# Then: :qe security_tester
# Then: Start asking questions!

# Option B: CLI (automation)
superqe run . --mode quick -r security_tester

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
1. Project Setup Guide - Detailed step-by-step setup
  2. Your First QE Session - Complete walkthrough
  3. Configuration Reference - Customize SuperQode
  4. Understanding Modes - Deep dive into ACP, BYOK, Local
  5. QE Roles - Learn about each role
  6. CI/CD Integration - Add to your pipeline

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
• Run superqode --help for command help
  • Use :help in the TUI for interactive help
  • Check the CLI Reference for detailed command documentation

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: This guide covers SuperQode configuration, from basic setup to advanced customization.

docs.title: Configuration Files
docs.text:
SuperQode uses YAML configuration files with the following precedence (highest to lowest):

  1. Project: ./superqode.yaml (current directory)
  2. User: ~/.superqode.yaml (home directory)
  3. System: /etc/superqode/superqode.yaml (system-wide)

docs.title: Initialize Configuration
docs.text:
Create a default configuration file:

# In your project directory (recommended)
cd /path/to/your/project
superqe init

superqe init writes a comprehensive role catalog to superqode.yaml. Keep only the roles you want enabled; leave the rest disabled or remove them.

docs.title: Minimal Configuration
docs.text:
# superqode.yaml
superqode:
  version: "2.0"
  team_name: "My Project"

# Default mode for all roles (ACP recommended)
default:
  mode: acp
  coding_agent: opencode

docs.title: Standard Configuration
docs.text:
# superqode.yaml
superqode:
  version: "2.0"
  team_name: "My Development Team"
  description: "Quality engineering configuration"

# Gateway settings
superqode:
  gateway:
    type: litellm  # or openresponses
  cost_tracking:
    enabled: true
    show_after_task: true

# Default execution mode (ACP recommended, or BYOK with Google)
default:
  mode: byok
  provider: google
  model: gemini-3-pro

# Provider-specific settings
providers:
  google:
    api_key_env: GOOGLE_API_KEY
    recommended_models:
      - gemini-3-pro
      - gemini-3
      - gemini-2.5-flash

  openai:
    api_key_env: OPENAI_API_KEY
    recommended_models:
      - gpt-4o
      - gpt-4o-mini

  ollama:
    base_url: http://localhost:11434
    recommended_models:
      - qwen3:8b
      - llama3.2:latest

docs.title: Team Configuration
docs.text:
Define roles and modes for your team:

team:
  modes:
    # Development mode
    dev:
      description: "Development team roles"
      enabled: true
      roles:
        fullstack:
          description: "Full-stack developer"
          mode: acp
          coding_agent: opencode
          enabled: true

    # Quality Engineering mode
    qe:
      description: "Quality engineering roles"
      enabled: true
      roles:
        lint_tester:
          description: "Fast static linting"
          enabled: true

        security_tester:
          description: "Security vulnerability detection"
          mode: acp
          coding_agent: opencode
          enabled: true
          job_description: |
            Focus on OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities,
            injection attacks, authentication flaws,
            and sensitive data exposure.

        api_tester:
          description: "API contract and security testing"
          mode: byok
          provider: google
          model: gemini-3-pro
          enabled: true
          job_description: |
            Test API endpoints for schema compliance,
            input validation, rate limiting, and
            proper error handling.

        performance_tester:
          description: "Performance bottleneck detection"
          mode: byok
          provider: openai
          model: gpt-4o
          enabled: true

        fullstack:
          description: "Senior QE comprehensive review"
          mode: acp
          coding_agent: opencode
          enabled: true

docs.title: QE Configuration
docs.text:
Configure quality engineering settings:

qe:
  # Output settings
  output:
    directory: ".superqode"
    reports_format: markdown  # markdown, html, json
    keep_history: true

  # Suggestion workflow (OFF by default)
  allow_suggestions: false
  suggestions:
    enabled: false
    verify_fixes: true
    require_proof: true
    auto_generate_tests: false
    max_fix_attempts: 3
    revert_on_failure: true

  # Noise filtering
  noise:
    min_confidence: 0.7
    deduplicate: true
    min_severity: "low"  # low, medium, high, critical
    suppress_known_risks: false
    max_per_file: 10
    max_total: 100

  # Execution modes
  modes:
    quick_scan:
      timeout: 60
      depth: shallow
      generate_tests: false
      destructive: false

    deep_qe:
      timeout: 1800
      depth: full
      generate_tests: true
      destructive: true

  # Harness validation
  harness:
    enabled: true
    timeout_seconds: 30
    fail_on_error: false
    structural_formats:
      - json
      - yaml
      - toml
    python_tools:
      - ruff
      - mypy
    javascript_tools:
      - eslint
    typescript_tools:
      - tsc
      - eslint
    go_tools:
      - go vet
      - golangci-lint
    rust_tools:
      - cargo check
    shell_tools:
      - shellcheck

docs.title: BYOK Providers
docs.text:
providers:
  # Anthropic (Claude)
  anthropic:
    api_key_env: ANTHROPIC_API_KEY
    description: "Claude models by Anthropic"
    recommended_models:
      - claude-opus-4-5
      - claude-sonnet-4-5
      - claude-haiku-4-5

  # OpenAI
  openai:
    api_key_env: OPENAI_API_KEY
    description: "GPT models by OpenAI"
    recommended_models:
      - gpt-4o
      - gpt-4o-mini
      - o1
      - o1-mini

  # Google AI
  google:
    api_key_env: GOOGLE_API_KEY
    description: "Gemini models by Google"
    recommended_models:
      - gemini-2.5-pro
      - gemini-2.5-flash

  # Deepseek
  deepseek:
    api_key_env: DEEPSEEK_API_KEY
    description: "Deepseek models"
    recommended_models:
      - deepseek-v3
      - deepseek-r1

  # OpenRouter (aggregator)
  openrouter:
    api_key_env: OPENROUTER_API_KEY
    description: "Access 95+ models via OpenRouter"
    recommended_models:
      - anthropic/claude-sonnet-4
      - openai/gpt-4o
      - google/gemini-2.5-pro

docs.title: Local Providers
docs.text:
providers:
  ollama:
    base_url: http://localhost:11434
    description: "Local Ollama models"
    type: openai-compatible
    recommended_models:
      - qwen3:8b
      - llama3.2:latest
      - codellama:13b

  lmstudio:
    base_url: http://localhost:1234
    description: "LM Studio local models"
    type: openai-compatible

  vllm:
    base_url: http://localhost:8000
    description: "vLLM inference server"
    type: openai-compatible

docs.title: OpenResponses Gateway
docs.text:
superqode:
  gateway:
    type: openresponses
    openresponses:
      base_url: http://localhost:11434
      reasoning_effort: medium  # low, medium, high
      truncation: auto
      timeout: 300.0
      enable_apply_patch: true
      enable_code_interpreter: true
      enable_file_search: false

docs.title: MCP Server Configuration
docs.text:
Configure Model Context Protocol servers:

mcp_servers:
  filesystem:
    transport: stdio
    enabled: true
    auto_connect: true
    command: npx
    args:
      - -y
      - "@modelcontextprotocol/server-filesystem"
      - "/path/to/workspace"

  github:
    transport: stdio
    enabled: true
    command: npx
    args:
      - -y
      - "@modelcontextprotocol/server-github"
    env:
      GITHUB_TOKEN: "${GITHUB_TOKEN}"

  database:
    transport: http
    enabled: false
    url: http://localhost:8080/mcp
    headers:
      Authorization: "Bearer ${MCP_DB_TOKEN}"
    timeout: 30.0

docs.title: Agent Configuration
docs.text:
Configure ACP agents:

agents:
  opencode:
    description: "OpenCode coding agent"
    protocol: acp
    command: opencode
    auth_file: ~/.local/share/opencode/auth.json
    capabilities:
      - file_editing
      - shell_execution
      - mcp_tools

  custom_agent:
    description: "Custom ACP agent"
    protocol: acp
    command: /path/to/agent
    args:
      - --mode
      - interactive

docs.title: Role Properties
docs.text: Property Type Description description string Human-readable role description mode enum Execution mode: byok, acp, local provider string Provider ID (for BYOK/Local) model string Model ID agent string Agent ID (for ACP mode) enabled bool Whether role is active job_description string Detailed job description for agent mcp_servers list MCP servers to connect expert_prompt_enabled bool Enterprise expert system prompts expert_prompt string Enterprise expert prompt override

docs.title: Example Role with All Options
docs.text:
team:
  modes:
    qe:
      roles:
        security_tester:
          description: "Security vulnerability detection"
          mode: byok
          provider: anthropic
          model: claude-sonnet-4
          enabled: true
          job_description: |
            You are a senior security engineer specializing in:
            - OWASP Top 10 vulnerability detection
            - SQL injection and XSS prevention
            - Authentication and authorization flaws
            - Sensitive data exposure
            - Security misconfigurations

            Focus on finding vulnerabilities that could be
            exploited in production environments.
          mcp_servers:
            - filesystem
          expert_prompt_enabled: false  # Enterprise
          cross_validation:
            enabled: true
            exclude_same_model: true

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text:
SuperQode respects these environment variables:

Variable Description SUPERQODE_CONFIG Path to configuration file SUPERQODE_OUTPUT_DIR Default output directory SUPERQODE_LOG_LEVEL Logging level (DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR) ANTHROPIC_API_KEY Anthropic API key OPENAI_API_KEY OpenAI API key GOOGLE_API_KEY Google AI API key DEEPSEEK_API_KEY Deepseek API key GROQ_API_KEY Groq API key OPENROUTER_API_KEY OpenRouter API key

docs.title: View Configuration
docs.text:
# List configured modes and roles
superqode config list-modes

# Show role details
superqode roles info qe.security_tester

docs.title: Modify Configuration
docs.text:
# Set model for a role
superqode config set-model qe.security_tester claude-opus-4-5

# Set agent for a role
superqode config set-agent qe.fullstack opencode

# Enable/disable roles
superqode config enable-role qe.performance_tester
superqode config disable-role qe.e2e_tester

docs.title: Configuration Validation
docs.text:
SuperQode validates configuration on load. Common validation errors:

Error Cause Solution Invalid provider Provider not in registry Check provider name spelling Missing API key Environment variable not set Set the required API key Invalid mode Mode not byok, acp, or local Use valid mode value Unknown agent Agent not registered Check agent name or install it

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• YAML Reference - Complete configuration reference
  • Team Configuration - Advanced team setup
  • Provider Setup - Provider-specific configuration
  • QE Settings - Quality engineering options

docs.title: Your First QE Session
docs.text: This guide walks you through a complete Quality Engineering session step-by-step, explaining each phase and output.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
A SuperQode QE session follows this lifecycle:

┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│                    QE SESSION LIFECYCLE                      │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                              │
│  1. SNAPSHOT         Original code preserved                 │
│        ↓                                                     │
│  2. QE SANDBOX       Agents freely modify, inject tests,    │
│        │             run experiments, break things           │
│        ↓                                                     │
│  3. ANALYSIS         Role-specific quality investigation    │
│        ↓                                                     │
│  4. REPORT           Document what was done, what was found │
│        ↓                                                     │
│  5. REVERT           All changes removed, original restored │
│        ↓                                                     │
│  6. ARTIFACTS        Patches, tests, reports preserved      │
│                      (in .superqode/qe-artifacts/)          │
│                                                              │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
Before starting, ensure you have:

  • SuperQode installed (superqode --version)
  • At least one provider configured (API key or local model)
  • A project directory to analyze

docs.title: Step 1: Navigate to Your Project
docs.text:
cd /path/to/your/project

Ensure you're in a Git repository (recommended for full workspace isolation):

git status

docs.title: Step 2: Launch SuperQode
docs.text:
Interactive Mode (TUI)Direct Command 
superqode

The TUI launches with the SuperQode interface.

superqe run . --mode quick

Runs QE directly without the TUI.

docs.title: Step 3: Connect to a Provider
docs.text:
In the TUI, connect to your preferred provider:

# ACP mode (recommended)
:connect acp opencode

# Or BYOK mode with Google
:connect byok google gemini-3-pro

You'll see a connection confirmation:

✓ Connected to opencode
  Mode: ACP
  Capabilities: chat, streaming, tools, file_editing, shell

docs.title: Quick Scan
docs.text:
For a fast 60-second analysis:

superqe run . --mode quick

Note: QE sessions are run via CLI commands. In the TUI, you interact directly with agents by typing natural language requests after switching to a QE role.

docs.title: Deep QE
docs.text:
For comprehensive 30-minute analysis:

superqe run . --mode deep

docs.title: Step 6: Understanding Role Execution
docs.text: Each role runs with a specific focus:

docs.title: Execution Roles (Deterministic)
docs.text:
These roles run existing tests:

Role Focus Duration smoke_tester Critical paths Fast (seconds) sanity_tester Core functionality Quick (< 1 min) regression_tester Full test suite Thorough (varies) lint_tester Static lint checks Fast (seconds)

docs.title: Detection Roles (AI-Powered)
docs.text:
These roles use AI to find issues:

Role Focus Typical Findings security_tester Vulnerabilities Injection, auth bypass, secrets api_tester API contracts Schema violations, missing validation unit_tester Coverage gaps Untested paths, edge cases performance_tester Bottlenecks N+1 queries, memory leaks e2e_tester Workflows Integration issues

docs.title: Heuristic Role
docs.text: Role Focus fullstack Senior QE comprehensive review

docs.title: Step 8: Review the Quality Report (QR)
docs.text:
The QR is a research-grade forensic report. View it:

cat .superqode/qe-artifacts/qr/qr-*.json | jq

docs.title: QR Structure
docs.text:
{
  "session": {
    "id": "qe-session-20240118-143022",
    "mode": "quick_scan",
    "duration_seconds": 58.7,
    "started_at": "2024-01-18T14:30:22Z",
    "completed_at": "2024-01-18T14:31:21Z"
  },
  "findings": [
    {
      "id": "finding-001",
      "title": "SQL Injection in User Search",
      "severity": "critical",
      "category": "security",
      "confidence": 0.95,
      "file_path": "src/api/users.py",
      "line_number": 42,
      "description": "User input is directly interpolated into SQL query without sanitization.",
      "reproduction_steps": [
        "1. Send GET request to /api/users?search='; DROP TABLE users; --",
        "2. Observe SQL error in response"
      ],
      "recommendation": "Use parameterized queries or ORM methods",
      "evidence": {
        "code_snippet": "query = f\"SELECT * FROM users WHERE name LIKE '%{search}%'\"",
        "test_result": "SQL syntax error returned, confirming injection"
      }
    }
  ],
  "summary": {
    "total_findings": 6,
    "by_severity": {
      "critical": 1,
      "high": 2,
      "medium": 2,
      "low": 1
    },
    "production_ready": false,
    "recommendation": "Address critical SQL injection before deployment"
  }
}

docs.title: Step 9: Review Individual Findings
docs.text:
Each finding in the QR contains:

Field Description id Unique identifier title Brief description severity critical, high, medium, low category security, performance, correctness, etc. confidence 0.0 - 1.0 confidence score file_path Location of the issue line_number Specific line (if applicable) description Detailed explanation reproduction_steps How to reproduce recommendation Suggested fix evidence Supporting data

docs.title: Step 10: Apply Suggested Fixes (Optional, Enterprise)
docs.text:
If you ran with --allow-suggestions, patches are available:

# List available suggestions
superqode suggestions list

# View a specific patch
cat .superqode/qe-artifacts/patches/fix-sql-injection.patch

# Apply a suggestion
superqode suggestions apply suggestion-001

Review Before Applying

Always review patches before applying. SuperQode suggests fixes but you make the final decision.

docs.title: Step 11: Provide Feedback (Enterprise)
docs.text:
Help improve SuperQode's accuracy by providing feedback:

# Mark finding as valid
superqe feedback finding-001 --valid

# Mark as false positive
superqe feedback finding-002 --false-positive -r "This is expected behavior"

Feedback improves the ML-based severity prediction for future sessions.

docs.title: Step 12: View Session Artifacts
docs.text:
All artifacts are preserved in .superqode/qe-artifacts/:

.superqode/qe-artifacts/
├── qr-20240118-143022.json       # Quality Report
├── patches/
│   ├── fix-sql-injection.patch    # Suggested fix patches
│   └── fix-rate-limiting.patch
├── tests/
│   └── generated/
│       ├── test_sql_injection.py  # Generated regression tests
│       └── test_api_security.py
├── reports/
└── qr/
    ├── qr-<date>-<session>.md
    └── qr-<date>-<session>.json

docs.title: Complete Session Example
docs.text:
Here's a complete example from start to finish:

# 1. Navigate to project
cd ~/projects/my-api

# 2. Run comprehensive QE
superqe run . \
  --mode deep \
  --timeout 1800 \
  --output .superqode/qe-artifacts

# 3. Wait for session to complete...

# 4. Review the QR
cat .superqode/qe-artifacts/qr/qr-*.md

# 5. Provide feedback on findings
superqe feedback finding-001 --valid
superqe feedback finding-003 --false-positive -r "Intentional behavior"

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
Now that you've completed your first session:

  1. Configure SuperQode - Customize roles and settings
  2. Understand QE Roles - Learn about each role
  3. Read QR Documentation - Deep dive into reports
  4. Set Up CI/CD - Automate QE in your pipeline
  5. Advanced Features - Custom roles, MCP, harness

docs.title: Troubleshooting First Session
docs.text:
Session times out before completion

Increase the timeout or use quick scan mode:

superqe run . --mode quick --timeout 120
No findings detected
  • Ensure the project has analyzable code
  • Try running specific roles: -r security_tester -r api_tester
  • Check that the provider is properly connected
Too many false positives

Configure noise filters:

# superqode.yaml
qe:
  noise:
    min_confidence: 0.8
    min_severity: "medium"
Workspace not reverting

Check that you're in a Git repository. For non-Git projects, snapshot isolation is used by default (worktree mode requires Git).

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: This guide covers all installation methods for SuperQode (TUI) and SuperQE (CLI), including prerequisites, verification, and troubleshooting.

docs.title: Quick Install
docs.text:
pip install superqode

That's it! Verify with:

superqode --version
superqe --version

docs.title: Minimum Requirements
docs.text: Component Requirement Operating System macOS 12+, Linux (Ubuntu 20.04+, Debian 11+), Windows 10+ (WSL2) Python 3.12 or higher Memory 4GB RAM minimum, 8GB recommended Disk Space 500MB for installation

docs.title: Python Version Check
docs.text:
python3 --version
# Should output: Python 3.12.x or higher

If you need to install Python 3.12+:

macOSUbuntu/DebianWindows (WSL2) 
brew install python@3.12

sudo apt update
sudo apt install python3.12 python3.12-venv

sudo apt update
sudo apt install python3.12 python3.12-venv

docs.title: Method 1: uv (Recommended)
docs.text:
Use uv for fast installs and isolated tooling:

# Install uv if needed
curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh

# Install SuperQode
uv tool install superqode

For isolated installation with a virtual environment:

# Create virtual environment
python3 -m venv ~/.superqode-venv
source ~/.superqode-venv/bin/activate

# Install SuperQode
uv pip install superqode

# Verify installation
superqode --version

docs.title: Method 2: pip
docs.text:
Standard pip installation:

# Install SuperQode
pip install superqode

# Verify installation
superqode --version

docs.title: Method 3: From Source (Development)
docs.text:
For contributors or those wanting the latest features:

# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/SuperagenticAI/superqode.git
cd superqode

# Create virtual environment
python3 -m venv .venv
source .venv/bin/activate

# Install in editable mode with dev dependencies
pip install -e ".[dev]"

# Verify installation
superqode --version

docs.title: 1. Initialize Configuration
docs.text:
# In your project directory, create a repo config
cd /path/to/your/project
superqe init

This creates superqode.yaml in the current directory (project-level config).

docs.title: 2. Set Up API Keys (BYOK Mode)
docs.text:
For cloud providers, set your API keys as environment variables:

AnthropicOpenAIGoogle AIAll Providers 
export ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=sk-ant-...

export OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-...

export GOOGLE_API_KEY=...
# or
export GEMINI_API_KEY=...

Add to your shell profile (~/.bashrc, ~/.zshrc):

# SuperQode API Keys
export ANTHROPIC_API_KEY=sk-ant-...
export OPENAI_API_KEY=sk-...
export GOOGLE_API_KEY=...
export DEEPSEEK_API_KEY=...
export GROQ_API_KEY=...

docs.title: 3. Verify Provider Configuration
docs.text:
# Check authentication status
superqode auth info

# List available providers
superqode providers list

# Test a specific provider
superqode providers test anthropic

docs.title: For Local Models
docs.text:
OllamaLM StudiovLLM 
# macOS
brew install ollama

# Linux
curl -fsSL https://ollama.com/install.sh | sh

# Start Ollama
ollama serve

# Pull a model
ollama pull qwen3:8b

Download from lmstudio.ai and install the desktop application.

pip install vllm

docs.title: For ACP Agents
docs.text:
OpenCode 
npm i -g opencode-ai

# Verify installation
opencode --version

docs.title: For Full QE Capabilities
docs.text:
Install language-specific linters for harness validation:

PythonJavaScript/TypeScriptGoRust 
pip install ruff mypy pyright

npm install -g eslint typescript

go install golang.org/x/lint/golint@latest
go install honnef.co/go/tools/cmd/staticcheck@latest

rustup component add clippy

docs.title: Basic Verification
docs.text:
# Check version
superqode --version

# View help
superqode --help

# Launch TUI
superqode

docs.title: Full Verification
docs.text:
# Check all dependencies
superqode auth info

# List providers
superqode providers list

# List agents
superqode agents list

# List QE roles
superqe roles

docs.title: Common Issues
docs.text:
Python version too old

Error: requires Python 3.12+

Solution: Install Python 3.12 or higher using your package manager or pyenv.

# Using pyenv
pyenv install 3.12.0
pyenv global 3.12.0
Command not found after installation

Error: superqode: command not found

Solution: Ensure your PATH includes the ~/.local/bin directory used by uv/pip.

export PATH="$HOME/.local/bin:$PATH"
source ~/.bashrc  # or ~/.zshrc
Permission denied

Error: Permission denied during installation

Solution: Use --user flag or install via uv:

pip install --user superqode
# or use uv
uv tool install superqode
SSL certificate errors

Error: SSL: CERTIFICATE_VERIFY_FAILED

Solution (macOS):

/Applications/Python\ 3.12/Install\ Certificates.command
Ollama connection refused

Error: Connection refused when using local models

Solution: Ensure Ollama is running:

ollama serve

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
If you encounter issues not covered here:

  1. Check the GitHub Issues
  2. Run with verbose logging: superqode --verbose

docs.title: Upgrade SuperQode
docs.text:
pipuv 
pip install --upgrade superqode

uv tool upgrade superqode

docs.title: Check for Updates
docs.text:
# View current version
superqode --version

# Check PyPI for latest version
pip index versions superqode

docs.title: Uninstalling
docs.text:
pipuv 
pip uninstall superqode

uv tool uninstall superqode

docs.title: Remove Configuration
docs.text:
# Remove user configuration
rm -rf ~/.superqode.yaml
rm -rf ~/.superqode/

# Remove project configurations
rm -rf .superqode/
rm -f superqode.yaml

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Quick Start Guide - Get started in 5 minutes
  • Your First QE Session - Complete walkthrough
  • Configuration - Customize SuperQode

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: Get started with SuperQode in 5 minutes.

docs.title: Install SuperQode
docs.text: pip install superqode

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
This guide covers:

  1. Project Setup - Initialize and configure your project
  2. Choose Workflow - TUI for exploration or CLI for automation
  3. Connect to Agent - Set up your preferred connection mode
  4. Run First QE Session - Start quality engineering

docs.title: Step 1: Initialize Your Project
docs.text:
Navigate to your project and initialize SuperQode:

cd /path/to/your/project
superqe init

This will: - Create superqode.yaml in the current directory from the comprehensive role catalog - Enable core, implemented roles so you can run immediately - Leave the rest disabled so you can prune what you don’t need

docs.title: Edit Configuration
docs.text:
After initialization, edit superqode.yaml to set your preferred model:

nano superqode.yaml

Choose your connection mode:

# Option 1: ACP (recommended for full features)
default:
  mode: acp
  coding_agent: opencode

# Option 2: BYOK (use your own API keys)
default:
  mode: byok
  provider: google
  model: gemini-3-pro

# Option 3: Local (privacy-first)
default:
  mode: local
  provider: ollama
  model: qwen3:8b

docs.title: Step 2: Choose Your Workflow
docs.text: SuperQode offers two workflows:

docs.title: TUI (Terminal UI) - For Exploratory Testing
docs.text:
Best for: Interactive exploration, ad-hoc testing, learning

# Launch TUI
superqode

Then use TUI commands: - :connect acp opencode - Connect to agent - :qe security_tester - Switch to security role - Chat with agent: "Check for SQL injection vulnerabilities"

docs.title: CLI (Command Line) - For Automation
docs.text:
Best for: CI/CD, batch processing, automation

# Run QE session directly
superqe run . --mode quick

# With specific roles
superqe run . -r security_tester -r api_tester

docs.title: Step 3: Run Your First QE Session
Quick Scan (60 seconds)
docs.text:
For fast feedback during development:

superqe run . --mode quick

Note: QE sessions are run via CLI commands, not TUI commands. In the TUI, you interact directly with agents by typing natural language requests after switching to a QE role with :qe <role>.

docs.title: Deep QE (Full Analysis)
docs.text:
For comprehensive quality analysis:

superqe run . --mode deep

docs.title: Step 4: View Results
docs.text: After a QE session completes, you'll see:

docs.title: Artifacts Location
docs.text:
All artifacts are saved to .superqode/qe-artifacts/:

.superqode/qe-artifacts/
├── manifest.json
├── qr/
│   ├── qr-<date>-<session>.json    # Quality Report (JSON)
│   └── qr-<date>-<session>.md      # Quality Report (Markdown)
├── patches/
│   └── ...                         # Suggested patch files (when available)
└── generated-tests/
    └── ...                         # Generated tests (when available)

docs.title: TUI Commands (prefix with :)
docs.text: Command Description :connect or :c Interactive connection picker (recommended) :connect acp <agent> Connect directly to ACP agent :connect byok <provider> <model> Connect directly to BYOK provider :connect local <provider> <model> Connect directly to local model :qe <role> Switch to QE role mode (e.g., :qe security_tester) :disconnect Disconnect current session :status Show session status :help Show help :quit Exit SuperQode

docs.title: CLI Commands
docs.text: Command Description superqode Launch TUI superqe run . Run QE on current directory superqode providers list List available providers superqode agents list List available agents superqe init Initialize configuration

docs.title: Example 1: Security Scan
docs.text:
# Run security-focused QE
superqe run . -r security_tester --mode quick

docs.title: Example 2: API Testing
docs.text:
# Test API endpoints
superqe run . -r api_tester -r unit_tester

docs.title: Example 3: Full QE with Suggestions (Enterprise)
docs.text:
# Deep QE with fix suggestions (sandbox mode)
superqe run . --mode deep --allow-suggestions --generate

docs.title: Example 4: CI-Friendly Output (Enterprise)
docs.text:
# JSONL output for CI/CD
superqe run . --mode quick --jsonl

# JUnit XML for test reporting
superqe run . --mode quick --junit results.xml

docs.title: Finding Severity Levels
docs.text: Severity Description Action Critical Security vulnerability, data loss risk Fix immediately High Significant bug or security issue Fix before release Medium Bug or code smell Fix soon Low Minor issue or suggestion Fix when convenient

docs.title: Confidence Scores
docs.text:
Each finding includes a confidence score (0.0 - 1.0):

  • 0.9 - 1.0: Very high confidence, verified finding
  • 0.7 - 0.9: High confidence, likely valid
  • 0.5 - 0.7: Medium confidence, review recommended
  • < 0.5: Low confidence, may be false positive

docs.title: Step 8: Keyboard Shortcuts (TUI)
docs.text: Shortcut Action Ctrl+C Cancel current operation Ctrl+D Exit SuperQode Ctrl+K Open command palette Ctrl+L Clear screen Ctrl+R Refresh Tab Auto-complete ↑/↓ Navigate history Esc Cancel/close dialog

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
Now that you've completed the quick start:

  1. Your First QE Session - Detailed walkthrough
  2. Configuration Guide - Customize SuperQode
  3. Understanding Modes - Learn about BYOK, ACP, Local
  4. QE Roles - Understand testing roles
  5. CI/CD Integration - Add to your pipeline

docs.title: Tips for Success
docs.text:
Start with Quick Scan

Use --mode quick during development for fast feedback. Save --mode deep for pre-release validation.

Focus on Critical Findings

Address critical and high severity findings first. Configure noise filters to reduce false positives.

Review Suggested Fixes

When using --allow-suggestions, always review the generated patches before applying.

Use CI Integration

Add SuperQode to your CI/CD pipeline with --jsonl output for automated quality gates.

docs.title: Troubleshooting Guide
docs.text: This guide helps you resolve common issues when using SuperQode.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Installation Issues
  • Agent Connection Problems
  • QE Analysis Failures
  • Performance Issues
  • Configuration Problems
  • Common Error Messages

docs.title: "ModuleNotFoundError" when running SuperQode
docs.text:
Problem: 

ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'superqode'

Solutions:

  1. Install in development mode: 

    cd /path/to/superqode
pip install -e .

  2. Check Python path: 

    python -c "import superqode; print('Import successful')"

  3. Reinstall: 

    pip uninstall superqode
pip install superqode

docs.title: OpenCode Installation Issues
docs.text:
Problem: 

❌ OpenCode not found. Install with: npm i -g opencode-ai

Solutions:

  1. Install OpenCode globally: 

    npm i -g opencode-ai

  2. Verify Node.js and npm: 

    node --version
npm --version

  3. Check npm permissions (macOS/Linux): 

    sudo npm i -g opencode-ai

  4. Manual installation: 

    # Clone and install manually
git clone https://github.com/sst/opencode.git
cd opencode
npm install
npm run build
npm link  # or npm install -g .

docs.title: "Agent not found" or "Agent unavailable"
docs.text:
Problem: 

❌ Agent 'opencode' not found

Solutions:

  1. Check OpenCode installation: 

    opencode --version

  2. Verify agent configuration in YAML: 

    team:
  qe:
    roles:
      unit_tester:
        enabled: true

  3. Restart SuperQode: 

    # Exit TUI and restart
superqode

docs.title: "ACP connection failed"
docs.text:
Problem: 

❌ ACP agent not available for unit_tester, providing graceful degradation

Solutions:

  1. Install OpenCode: 

    npm i -g opencode-ai

  2. Check OpenCode status: 

    opencode --help

  3. Verify ACP adapter: 

    npm install -g @josephschmitt/opencode-acp  # If using ACP adapter

docs.title: "No tests detected" when tests exist
docs.text:
Problem: 

Verdict: 🟠 NO TESTS DETECTED - Add tests for proper validation

Solutions:

  1. Check test file patterns:
  2. Default patterns: **/*test* **/*spec* **/test_*
  3. Python: test_*.py, *test*.py

  4. JavaScript: *.test.js, *.spec.js

  5. Run with verbose logging: 

    superqe run . --verbose

  6. Check file permissions: 

    find . -name "*test*" -type f -ls

docs.title: "Failed to parse jest JSON output"
docs.text:
Problem: 

Failed to parse jest JSON output: Expecting value: line 1 column 1 (char 0)

Solutions:

  1. This is usually harmless - it's just Jest output parsing issues
  2. To suppress warnings, ensure proper Jest configuration
  3. Use different test runners if needed

docs.title: Deep QE not showing agent activity
docs.text:
Problem: 

superqe run . --mode deep
# Nothing appears in console

Solutions:

  1. Use verbose flag: 

    superqe run . --mode deep --verbose

  2. Check OpenCode installation: 

    opencode --version

  3. Verify agent roles are enabled: 

    team:
  qe:
    roles:
      api_tester:
        enabled: true
      security_tester:
        enabled: true

docs.title: Slow startup time
docs.text:
Problem: SuperQode takes too long to start

Solutions:

  1. Use lazy loading (already implemented)

  2. Check system resources: 

    top  # or htop

  3. Close other memory-intensive applications

docs.title: High memory usage during QE
docs.text:
Problem: QE analysis uses too much memory

Solutions:

  1. Memory limits are already implemented (50MB per process)

  2. Run smaller analysis scopes: 

    superqe run ./src --mode quick

  3. Use worktree isolation: 

    superqe run . --worktree

docs.title: Agent timeouts
docs.text:
Problem: 

⏰ Agent analysis timed out after 30s

Solutions:

  1. Increase timeout: 

    superqe run . --timeout 60

  2. Use specific roles instead of all: 

    superqe run . -r unit_tester

docs.title: YAML configuration not loading
docs.text:
Problem: 

Configuration error: Invalid YAML format

Solutions:

  1. Validate YAML syntax: 

    python -c "import yaml; yaml.safe_load(open('superqode.yaml'))"

  2. Check indentation (YAML is space-sensitive)

  3. Use online YAML validators

docs.title: Roles not appearing
docs.text:
Problem: Expected roles don't show up in TUI

Solutions:

  1. Check YAML structure: 

    team:
  qe:
    roles:
      unit_tester:
        enabled: true

  2. Restart SuperQode after config changes

  3. Use superqe init to reset configuration

docs.title: "Another QE session is already running"
docs.text:
Problem: Multiple QE sessions conflict

Solution: 

# Check running sessions
superqe status

# View session logs
superqe logs

docs.title: "Permission denied" errors
docs.text:
Problem: File system access issues

Solutions: 

# Check permissions
ls -la /path/to/project

# Fix permissions
chmod -R u+rwx /path/to/project

# Or run with sudo (not recommended)
sudo superqe run .

docs.title: "Connection refused" for MCP servers
docs.text:
Problem: MCP servers not accessible

Solutions:

  1. Check MCP server configuration in YAML

  2. Verify MCP server processes are running: 

    ps aux | grep mcp

  3. Restart MCP servers: 

    mcp:
  servers:
    filesystem:
      command: "npx -y @modelcontextprotocol/server-filesystem /tmp"

docs.title: "Import error" for custom modules
docs.text:
Problem: Python path issues in QE analysis

Solutions:

  1. Check Python environment: 

    which python
python -c "import sys; print(sys.path)"

  2. Use virtual environment: 

    python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate
pip install superqode

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
If these solutions don't resolve your issue:

  1. Check the logs: 

    superqe logs

  2. Run with debug output: 

    superqode --debug qe run .

  3. Report issues on GitHub:

  4. Include full error messages
  5. Describe your environment (OS, Python version, etc.)

  6. Provide steps to reproduce

  7. Community support:

  8. Check GitHub Discussions
  9. Join the SuperQode community

docs.title: Health Check
docs.text:
Run this health check command to diagnose common issues:

python -c "
import sys
import subprocess
import shutil

print('🔍 SuperQode Health Check')
print('=' * 40)

# Check Python version
print(f'Python: {sys.version}')

# Check required packages
try:
    import textual
    print('✅ Textual available')
except ImportError:
    print('❌ Textual missing')

try:
    import rich
    print('✅ Rich available')
except ImportError:
    print('❌ Rich missing')

# Check OpenCode
if shutil.which('opencode'):
    print('✅ OpenCode available')
    try:
        result = subprocess.run(['opencode', '--version'], capture_output=True, text=True, timeout=5)
        if result.returncode == 0:
            print(f'   Version: {result.stdout.strip()}')
        else:
            print('❌ OpenCode not working')
    except:
        print('❌ OpenCode check failed')
else:
    print('❌ OpenCode not found')

# Check Node.js
if shutil.which('node'):
    try:
        result = subprocess.run(['node', '--version'], capture_output=True, text=True, timeout=5)
        print(f'✅ Node.js: {result.stdout.strip()}')
    except:
        print('❌ Node.js check failed')
else:
    print('❌ Node.js not found')

print('\\n💡 Run \"superqe run .\" to test QE functionality')
"

docs.title: Integration
docs.text: Integrate SuperQode into your development workflow, CI/CD pipelines, and toolchain.

docs.title: Integration Options
docs.text:
• CI/CD Pipelines

    Automate quality gates in your CI/CD pipeline.

    CI/CD Integration

  • GitHub Actions

    Ready-to-use workflows for GitHub.

    GitHub Actions

  • GitLab CI

    Integration with GitLab CI/CD.

    GitLab CI

  • IDE Integration (Enterprise)

    LSP server and VSCode extension for editor integration.

    IDE Integration

docs.title: Pre-Commit Hook
docs.text:
Add quality checks before commits:

# .git/hooks/pre-commit
#!/bin/bash
superqe run . --mode quick -r security_tester
if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    echo "QE found issues. Fix them before committing."
    exit 1
fi

docs.title: GitHub Actions
docs.text:
# .github/workflows/qe.yml
name: Quality Engineering
on: [push, pull_request]

jobs:
  qe:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: '3.12'
      - run: pip install superqode
      - run: superqe run . --mode quick --json
        env:
          ANTHROPIC_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY }}

docs.title: Output Formats
docs.text:
SuperQode supports multiple output formats for integration:

Format Use Case Command Console Interactive use Default JSONL CI streaming (Enterprise) --jsonl JUnit XML Test reporting (Enterprise) --junit results.xml JSON Programmatic access --json

docs.title: Block on Critical Issues
docs.text:
superqe run . --mode quick

# Check exit code
if [ $? -eq 1 ]; then
    echo "Critical issues found"
    exit 1
fi

docs.title: Parse QR for Custom Gates
docs.text:
CRITICAL=$(cat .superqode/qe-artifacts/qr-*.json | jq '.summary.by_severity.critical')
if [ "$CRITICAL" -gt 0 ]; then
    echo "Critical issues found, blocking merge"
    exit 1
fi

docs.title: Environment Variables
docs.text:
Required for CI environments:

Variable Description ANTHROPIC_API_KEY Anthropic API key OPENAI_API_KEY OpenAI API key CI Set to true in CI environments

docs.title: Caching
docs.text: Cache dependencies for faster CI runs:

docs.title: GitHub Actions
docs.text:
- uses: actions/cache@v4
  with:
    path: ~/.cache/pip
    key: ${{ runner.os }}-pip-superqode

docs.title: GitLab CI
docs.text:
cache:
  paths:
    - ~/.cache/pip

docs.title: Artifacts
docs.text: Preserve QE artifacts in CI:

docs.title: GitHub Actions
docs.text:
- uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
  with:
    name: qe-artifacts
    path: .superqode/qe-artifacts/

docs.title: GitLab CI
docs.text:
artifacts:
  paths:
    - .superqode/qe-artifacts/
  when: always

docs.title: 1. Use Quick Mode in CI
docs.text:
For fast feedback in PRs:

superqe run . --mode quick

docs.title: 2. Deep QE on Schedule
docs.text:
Run comprehensive analysis nightly:

on:
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 0 * * *'  # Daily at midnight
jobs:
  deep-qe:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - run: superqe run . --mode deep

docs.title: 3. Security Focus on PRs
docs.text:
Focus on security for PRs:

superqe run . --mode quick -r security_tester

docs.title: 4. Report to PR Comments
docs.text:
Add findings as PR comments (GitHub Actions):

- name: Comment on PR
  uses: actions/github-script@v7
  with:
    script: |
      const fs = require('fs');
      const path = require('path');

      // Pick the most recent QR JSON artifact.
      const qrDir = '.superqode/qe-artifacts/qr';
      const candidates = fs.readdirSync(qrDir)
        .filter((f) => f.startsWith('qr-') && f.endsWith('.json'))
        .map((f) => ({ f, mtime: fs.statSync(path.join(qrDir, f)).mtimeMs }))
        .sort((a, b) => b.mtime - a.mtime);

      if (!candidates.length) {
        throw new Error(`No QR JSON artifacts found in ${qrDir}. Did the QE job generate artifacts?`);
      }

      const qr = JSON.parse(fs.readFileSync(path.join(qrDir, candidates[0].f), 'utf8'));
      github.rest.issues.createComment({
        issue_number: context.issue.number,
        owner: context.repo.owner,
        repo: context.repo.repo,
        body: JSON.stringify(qr.summary ?? qr, null, 2)
      });

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• CI/CD Integration - Detailed CI/CD setup
  • GitHub Actions - GitHub workflows
  • IDE Integration - LSP and editor integration

docs.title: CI/CD Integration
docs.text: Automate SuperQode quality gates in your CI/CD pipeline.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
SuperQode integrates with any CI/CD system through:

  • JSONL streaming for real-time event processing (enterprise feature)
  • JUnit XML for test reporting (enterprise feature)
  • Exit codes for simple pass/fail
  • JSON output for programmatic access

OSS tip: use superqe run . --json > results.json when JSONL/JUnit are unavailable.

docs.title: JSONL Streaming (Enterprise)
docs.text:
Stream events in real-time:

superqe run . --jsonl

Output: 

{"type":"qe.started","timestamp":"2024-01-18T14:30:22Z","data":{"mode":"quick"}}
{"type":"role.started","timestamp":"2024-01-18T14:30:23Z","data":{"role":"security_tester"}}
{"type":"finding.detected","timestamp":"2024-01-18T14:30:45Z","data":{"id":"finding-001","severity":"critical"}}
{"type":"qe.completed","timestamp":"2024-01-18T14:31:22Z","data":{"findings":3}}

docs.title: JUnit XML (Enterprise)
docs.text:
Export for test reporting tools:

superqe run . --junit results.xml

Compatible with: - Jenkins - GitHub Actions - GitLab CI - CircleCI - Azure DevOps

docs.title: Exit Codes
docs.text: Code Meaning 0 Success, no critical/high findings 1 Findings detected or error 130 Interrupted (Ctrl+C)

docs.title: Basic Gate
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
superqe run . --mode quick

if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then
    echo "QE failed, blocking deployment"
    exit 1
fi

docs.title: Severity-Based Gate
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
superqe run . --mode quick --json > results.json

CRITICAL=$(jq '.summary.by_severity.critical' results.json)
HIGH=$(jq '.summary.by_severity.high' results.json)

if [ "$CRITICAL" -gt 0 ]; then
    echo "Critical issues found, blocking deployment"
    exit 1
fi

if [ "$HIGH" -gt 2 ]; then
    echo "Too many high severity issues"
    exit 1
fi

echo "Quality gate passed"

docs.title: Custom Gate Script
docs.text:
#!/usr/bin/env python3
import json
import sys
import glob

# Find latest QR
qr_files = glob.glob('.superqode/qe-artifacts/qr-*.json')
if not qr_files:
    print("No QR found")
    sys.exit(1)

latest_qr = max(qr_files)
with open(latest_qr) as f:
    qr = json.load(f)

summary = qr['summary']

# Custom rules
if summary['by_severity'].get('critical', 0) > 0:
    print(f"BLOCKED: {summary['by_severity']['critical']} critical issues")
    sys.exit(1)

if not summary.get('production_ready', True):
    print("BLOCKED: Not production ready")
    sys.exit(1)

print("PASSED: Quality gate passed")
sys.exit(0)

docs.title: JSONL Event Types
docs.text: Event Type Description qe.started QE session started qe.completed QE session completed role.started Role execution started role.completed Role execution completed finding.detected New finding detected suggestion.created Fix suggestion created error Error occurred

docs.title: Processing JSONL
docs.text:
superqe run . --jsonl | while read event; do
    TYPE=$(echo $event | jq -r '.type')

    case $TYPE in
        "qe.started")
            echo "🚀 QE session started"
            ;;
        "finding.detected")
            TITLE=$(echo $event | jq -r '.data.title')
            SEVERITY=$(echo $event | jq -r '.data.severity')
            echo "🔍 Found: [$SEVERITY] $TITLE"
            ;;
        "qe.completed")
            FINDINGS=$(echo $event | jq -r '.data.total_findings')
            echo "✅ Complete: $FINDINGS findings"
            ;;
    esac
done

docs.title: Jenkins
docs.text:
pipeline {
    agent any

    environment {
        ANTHROPIC_API_KEY = credentials('anthropic-api-key')
    }

    stages {
        stage('Quality Engineering') {
            steps {
                sh 'pip install superqode'
                sh 'superqe run . --mode quick --junit results.xml'
            }
            post {
                always {
                    junit 'results.xml'
                    archiveArtifacts artifacts: '.superqode/qe-artifacts/**/*'
                }
            }
        }
    }
}

docs.title: GitLab CI
docs.text:
# .gitlab-ci.yml
stages:
  - quality

qe:
  stage: quality
  image: python:3.12
  variables:
    ANTHROPIC_API_KEY: $ANTHROPIC_API_KEY
  script:
    - pip install superqode
    - superqe run . --mode quick --junit results.xml
  artifacts:
    reports:
      junit: results.xml
    paths:
      - .superqode/qe-artifacts/
    when: always

docs.title: CircleCI
docs.text:
# .circleci/config.yml
version: 2.1

jobs:
  qe:
    docker:
      - image: python:3.12
    steps:
      - checkout
      - run:
          name: Install SuperQode
          command: pip install superqode
      - run:
          name: Run QE
          command: superqe run . --mode quick --junit results.xml
      - store_test_results:
          path: results.xml
      - store_artifacts:
          path: .superqode/qe-artifacts/

workflows:
  quality:
    jobs:
      - qe

docs.title: Azure DevOps
docs.text:
# azure-pipelines.yml
trigger:
  - main
  - develop

pool:
  vmImage: 'ubuntu-latest'

steps:
  - task: UsePythonVersion@0
    inputs:
      versionSpec: '3.12'

  - script: pip install superqode
    displayName: 'Install SuperQode'

  - script: superqe run . --mode quick --junit results.xml
    displayName: 'Run QE'
    env:
      ANTHROPIC_API_KEY: $(ANTHROPIC_API_KEY)

  - task: PublishTestResults@2
    inputs:
      testResultsFormat: 'JUnit'
      testResultsFiles: 'results.xml'
    condition: always()

docs.title: PR Checks (Quick Mode)
docs.text:
Fast feedback on every PR:

on:
  pull_request:

jobs:
  qe-quick:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - run: superqe run . --mode quick -r security_tester

docs.title: Nightly Deep Analysis
docs.text:
Comprehensive analysis on schedule:

on:
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 0 * * *'

jobs:
  qe-deep:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - run: superqe run . --mode deep --allow-suggestions

docs.title: Release Gate
docs.text:
Block releases on findings:

on:
  release:
    types: [created]

jobs:
  qe-release:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - run: superqe run . --mode deep
      - name: Check for blockers
        run: |
          CRITICAL=$(cat .superqode/qe-artifacts/qr-*.json | jq '.summary.by_severity.critical')
          if [ "$CRITICAL" -gt 0 ]; then
            exit 1
          fi

docs.title: Slack Integration
docs.text:
#!/bin/bash
superqe run . --mode quick --json > results.json

FINDINGS=$(jq '.summary.total_findings' results.json)
CRITICAL=$(jq '.summary.by_severity.critical' results.json)

if [ "$CRITICAL" -gt 0 ]; then
    curl -X POST -H 'Content-type: application/json' \
        --data "{\"text\":\"🚨 QE found $CRITICAL critical issues!\"}" \
        $SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL
fi

docs.title: GitHub PR Comment
docs.text: See GitHub Actions for PR comment integration.

docs.title: Cache SuperQode
docs.text:
# GitHub Actions
- uses: actions/cache@v4
  with:
    path: |
      ~/.cache/pip
      ~/.superqode
    key: ${{ runner.os }}-superqode-${{ hashFiles('**/requirements.txt') }}

docs.title: Cache Provider Responses
docs.text:
Some responses can be cached to reduce API costs:

qe:
  cache:
    enabled: true
    ttl: 3600  # 1 hour

docs.title: 1. Use Appropriate Modes
docs.text: Trigger Mode Roles PR quick security_tester Merge quick all Nightly deep all Release deep all

docs.title: 2. Set Timeouts

jobs:
  qe:
    timeout-minutes: 30
    steps:
      - run: superqe run . --mode quick --timeout 300

docs.title: 3. Handle Failures Gracefully

- run: superqe run . --mode quick || true
  continue-on-error: true
- run: cat .superqode/qe-artifacts/qr/qr-*.md

docs.title: 4. Secure API Keys
docs.text:
Never commit API keys. Use CI secrets:

  • GitHub: Repository secrets
  • GitLab: CI/CD variables
  • Jenkins: Credentials plugin

docs.title: GitHub Actions
docs.text:
Ready-to-use GitHub Actions workflows for SuperQode integration.

Note: JSONL streaming and JUnit output are enterprise features. OSS can use --json and redirect output to a file.

docs.title: Basic Workflow
docs.text:
# .github/workflows/qe.yml
name: Quality Engineering

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
  pull_request:
    branches: [main]

jobs:
  qe:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: '3.12'

      - name: Install SuperQode
        run: pip install superqode

      - name: Run QE
        run: superqe run . --mode quick --junit results.xml
        env:
          ANTHROPIC_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY }}

      - name: Upload Results
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        if: always()
        with:
          name: qe-artifacts
          path: .superqode/qe-artifacts/

docs.title: PR Security Check
docs.text:
Fast security scan on every PR:

name: PR Security Check

on:
  pull_request:

jobs:
  security:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: '3.12'
          cache: 'pip'

      - run: pip install superqode

      - name: Security Scan
        run: superqe run . --mode quick -r security_tester --junit results.xml
        env:
          ANTHROPIC_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY }}

      - name: Report Results
        uses: dorny/test-reporter@v1
        if: always()
        with:
          name: Security Findings
          path: results.xml
          reporter: java-junit

docs.title: Full QE on Push
docs.text:
Comprehensive QE on main branch:

name: Full QE

on:
  push:
    branches: [main]

jobs:
  qe:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    timeout-minutes: 45
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: '3.12'

      - run: pip install superqode

      - name: Run Deep QE
        run: superqe run . --mode deep --junit results.xml
        env:
          ANTHROPIC_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY }}

      - name: Upload Artifacts
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        if: always()
        with:
          name: qe-artifacts
          path: .superqode/qe-artifacts/

      - name: Publish Results
        uses: dorny/test-reporter@v1
        if: always()
        with:
          name: QE Findings
          path: results.xml
          reporter: java-junit

docs.title: Nightly Analysis
docs.text:
Scheduled comprehensive analysis:

name: Nightly QE

on:
  schedule:
    - cron: '0 0 * * *'  # Daily at midnight UTC
  workflow_dispatch:  # Allow manual trigger

jobs:
  deep-qe:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    timeout-minutes: 60
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: '3.12'

      - run: pip install superqode

      - name: Run Deep QE with Suggestions
        run: |
          superqe run . \
            --mode deep \
            --allow-suggestions \
            --generate \
            --junit results.xml
        env:
          ANTHROPIC_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY }}

      - name: Upload All Artifacts
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        if: always()
        with:
          name: qe-artifacts-${{ github.run_id }}
          path: .superqode/qe-artifacts/
          retention-days: 30

      - name: Create Issue if Critical
        if: failure()
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          script: |
            github.rest.issues.create({
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo,
              title: 'QE: Critical Issues Found',
              body: 'Nightly QE found critical issues. Check the workflow artifacts.'
            });

docs.title: PR Comment with Findings
docs.text:
Post QE summary as PR comment:

name: QE with PR Comment

on:
  pull_request:

jobs:
  qe:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    permissions:
      pull-requests: write
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: '3.12'

      - run: pip install superqode

      - name: Run QE
        id: qe
        run: |
          superqe run . --mode quick --json > qe-output.json
          echo "findings=$(jq '.summary.total_findings' qe-output.json)" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          echo "critical=$(jq '.summary.by_severity.critical' qe-output.json)" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
        env:
          ANTHROPIC_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY }}

      - name: Comment on PR
        uses: actions/github-script@v7
        with:
          script: |
            const findings = ${{ steps.qe.outputs.findings }};
            const critical = ${{ steps.qe.outputs.critical }};

            let status = '[CORRECT] No issues found';
            if (critical > 0) {
              status = '🚨 Critical issues found';
            } else if (findings > 0) {
              status = 'WARNING: Issues found';
            }

            const body = `## SuperQode QE Results

            ${status}

            | Severity | Count |
            |----------|-------|
            | Total | ${findings} |
            | Critical | ${critical} |

            [View Full Report](${context.serverUrl}/${context.repo.owner}/${context.repo.repo}/actions/runs/${context.runId})
            `;

            github.rest.issues.createComment({
              issue_number: context.issue.number,
              owner: context.repo.owner,
              repo: context.repo.repo,
              body: body
            });

docs.title: Quality Gate
docs.text:
Block merge on critical issues:

name: Quality Gate

on:
  pull_request:

jobs:
  quality-gate:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - uses: actions/setup-python@v5
        with:
          python-version: '3.12'

      - run: pip install superqode

      - name: Run QE
        run: superqe run . --mode quick --json > qe-output.json
        env:
          ANTHROPIC_API_KEY: ${{ secrets.ANTHROPIC_API_KEY }}

      - name: Check Quality Gate
        run: |
          CRITICAL=$(jq '.summary.by_severity.critical' qe-output.json)
          HIGH=$(jq '.summary.by_severity.high' qe-output.json)

          if [ "$CRITICAL" -gt 0 ]; then
            echo "[INCORRECT] BLOCKED: $CRITICAL critical issues found"
            exit 1
          fi

          if [ "$HIGH" -gt 5 ]; then
            echo "[INCORRECT] BLOCKED: Too many high severity issues ($HIGH)"
            exit 1
          fi

          echo "[CORRECT] Quality gate passed"

docs.title: GitLab CI Integration
docs.text:
Integrate SuperQode into your GitLab CI/CD pipelines for automated quality gates.

Note: JSONL streaming and JUnit output are enterprise features. OSS can use --json and redirect output to a file.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
SuperQode integrates seamlessly with GitLab CI/CD through:

  • JUnit XML reports: Native test reporting in GitLab
  • Artifacts: Preserve QE results and QRs
  • Exit codes: Simple pass/fail for quality gates
  • JSONL streaming: Real-time event processing

docs.title: Basic Workflow
docs.text:
# .gitlab-ci.yml
stages:
  - quality

qe:
  stage: quality
  image: python:3.12
  variables:
    ANTHROPIC_API_KEY: $ANTHROPIC_API_KEY
  script:
    - pip install superqode
    - superqe run . --mode quick --junit results.xml
  artifacts:
    reports:
      junit: results.xml
    paths:
      - .superqode/qe-artifacts/
    when: always

docs.title: Quick Scan on Every Push
docs.text:
# .gitlab-ci.yml
stages:
  - quality

qe-quick:
  stage: quality
  image: python:3.12
  variables:
    ANTHROPIC_API_KEY: $ANTHROPIC_API_KEY
  before_script:
    - pip install --upgrade pip
    - pip install superqode
  script:
    - superqe run . --mode quick --junit results.xml --jsonl
  artifacts:
    reports:
      junit: results.xml
    paths:
      - .superqode/qe-artifacts/
      - events.jsonl
    expire_in: 30 days
    when: always
  only:
    - merge_requests
    - branches

docs.title: Deep QE on Schedule
docs.text:
# .gitlab-ci.yml
qe-deep:
  stage: quality
  image: python:3.12
  variables:
    ANTHROPIC_API_KEY: $ANTHROPIC_API_KEY
  before_script:
    - pip install --upgrade pip
    - pip install superqode
  script:
    - superqe run . --mode deep --junit results.xml --allow-suggestions
  artifacts:
    reports:
      junit: results.xml
    paths:
      - .superqode/qe-artifacts/
    expire_in: 90 days
    when: always
  only:
    - schedules
  rules:
    - if: $CI_PIPELINE_SOURCE == "schedule"

docs.title: Security-Focused PR Checks
docs.text:
# .gitlab-ci.yml
qe-security:
  stage: quality
  image: python:3.12
  variables:
    ANTHROPIC_API_KEY: $ANTHROPIC_API_KEY
  script:

docs.title: Multi-Stage Workflow
docs.text:
# .gitlab-ci.yml
stages:
  - build
  - test
  - quality
  - deploy

build:
  stage: build
  script:
    - npm install
    - npm run build

test:
  stage: test
  script:
    - npm test

quality-engineering:
  stage: quality
  image: python:3.12
  variables:
    ANTHROPIC_API_KEY: $ANTHROPIC_API_KEY
  script:
    - pip install superqode
    - superqe run . --mode quick --junit qe-results.xml
  artifacts:
    reports:
      junit: qe-results.xml
    paths:
      - .superqode/qe-artifacts/
  needs:
    - build
    - test

deploy:
  stage: deploy
  script:
    - echo "Deploy..."
  needs:
    - quality-engineering
  only:
    - main

docs.title: CI/CD Variables
docs.text:
Configure API keys in GitLab CI/CD settings:

Settings → CI/CD → Variables

Variable Description Protected Masked ANTHROPIC_API_KEY Anthropic API key [CORRECT] [CORRECT] OPENAI_API_KEY OpenAI API key [CORRECT] [CORRECT] GOOGLE_API_KEY Google API key [CORRECT] [CORRECT]

Access in YAML:

docs.title: Block Merge on Critical Issues
docs.text:
qe-gate:
  stage: quality
  image: python:3.12
  script:
    - pip install superqode jq
    - superqe run . --mode quick --json > results.json
    - |
      CRITICAL=$(jq '.summary.by_severity.critical' results.json)
      if [ "$CRITICAL" -gt 0 ]; then
        echo "Critical issues found, blocking merge"
        exit 1
      fi
  only:
    - merge_requests

docs.title: Custom Severity Threshold
docs.text:
qe-custom:
  stage: quality
  script:
    - pip install superqode jq
    - superqe run . --mode quick --json > results.json
    - |
      CRITICAL=$(jq '.summary.by_severity.critical' results.json)
      HIGH=$(jq '.summary.by_severity.high' results.json)

      if [ "$CRITICAL" -gt 0 ]; then
        echo "[INCORRECT] Critical issues found: $CRITICAL"
        exit 1
      fi

      if [ "$HIGH" -gt 5 ]; then
        echo "WARNING: Too many high severity issues: $HIGH"
        exit 1
      fi

      echo "[CORRECT] Quality gate passed"

docs.title: Send Results to Slack
docs.text:
qe:
  script:
    - pip install superqode jq curl
    - superqe run . --mode quick --json > results.json
    - |
      CRITICAL=$(jq '.summary.by_severity.critical' results.json)
      if [ "$CRITICAL" -gt 0 ]; then
        curl -X POST -H 'Content-type: application/json' \
          --data "{\"text\":\"🚨 QE found $CRITICAL critical issues in $CI_PROJECT_NAME\"}" \
          $SLACK_WEBHOOK_URL
      fi
  variables:

docs.title: Always Upload Artifacts

qe:
  script:

    when: always  # Upload even if job fails

docs.title: Process Events in Pipeline
docs.text:
qe:
  script:
    - pip install superqode jq
    - |
      superqe run . --mode quick --jsonl | tee events.jsonl | while read event; do
        TYPE=$(echo $event | jq -r '.type')
        if [ "$TYPE" = "finding.detected" ]; then
          SEVERITY=$(echo $event | jq -r '.severity')
          TITLE=$(echo $event | jq -r '.title')
          echo "Found: [$SEVERITY] $TITLE"
        fi
      done
  artifacts:
    paths:
      - events.jsonl

pages:

  script:
    - mkdir -p public
    - cp -r .superqode/qe-artifacts/*.html public/ || true
  artifacts:
    paths:
      - public
  only:
    - main

Problem: QE job times out

Solution: Increase timeout or use quick mode:

qe:
  timeout: 30m
  script:
    - superqe run . --mode quick

Problem: Artifacts not available

Solution: Ensure when: always:

  when: always

Solution: Configure in CI/CD variables: - Settings → CI/CD → Variables - Add ANTHROPIC_API_KEY with protected/masked enabled
